text: The June 2011 Christchurch earthquake was responsible for causing additional damage to an already earthquake-devastated region. The earthquake took place around 1420 New Zealand Standard Time and was centered next to 3.8 miles deep, six miles from Christchurch. It had been preceded by another 5.9 tremor that struck at a slightly deeper 5.5 miles. The earthquake of June 2011 cut down telephone lines and caused numerous outages which left next to 54,000 houses without power. The tremor triggered the death of an elderly man and several injuries. ==References== ==Related pages== * 2011 Christchurch earthquake (February) Category:2011 in New Zealand Category:Earthquakes in New Zealand Category:2011 earthquakes Category:June 2011 events Category:2010s disasters in New Zealand
title: June 2011 Christchurch earthquake
